DataElement.preferredName: Cyclophosphamide Dose Reduced Yes No Unknown Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The Yes/No indicator if there was a reduction in dose of Cyclophosphamide.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A synthetic alkylating agent chemically related to the nitrogen mustards with antineoplastic and immunosuppressive activities. In the liver, cyclophosphamide is converted to the active metabolites aldophosphamide and phosphoramide mustard, which bind to DNA, thereby inhibiting DNA replication and initiating cell death.:An indication that a medication schedule was modified by subtraction, either by changing the frequency, strength or amount.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A synthetic alkylating agent chemically related to the nitrogen mustards with antineoplastic and immunosuppressive activities.  In the liver, cyclophosphamide is converted to the active metabolites aldophosphamide and phosphoramide mustard, which bind to DNA, thereby inhibiting DNA replication and initiating cell death. (NCI04)

Concepts.definition: A synthetic alkylating agent chemically related to the nitrogen mustards with antineoplastic and immunosuppressive activities. In the liver, cyclophosphamide is converted to the active metabolites aldophosphamide and phosphoramide mustard, which bind to DNA, thereby inhibiting DNA replication and initiating cell death.

Property.preferredDefinition: An indication that a medication schedule was modified by subtraction, either by changing the frequency, strength or amount.

Concepts.definition: An indication that a medication schedule was modified by subtraction, either by changing the frequency, strength or amount.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, unknown, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, Unknown, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, unknown, or not applicable.
